result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIEL LEE DENHAM was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due October 21, 2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Successfully complete Eau Claire Drug Court

Absolute sobriety.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities except in a therapeutic setting, such as Drug Court.
